oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance and interview - Steve Wariner - 12-13-2003
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by and interview with Steve Wariner from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on December 13, 2003.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Steve Wariner;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Set up and walk in music recorded for first 12 minutes 40 seconds. Introduction and interview conducted by Jay Orr. Includes questions from the audience. Subjects include: Current guitar Christmas album and influence of Chet Atkins -- Chet's guitars on display in the museum -- meeting Chet Atkins -- First Christmas album and cover photo with dog and horse -- Selectone Records - Steve's favorite Christmas memories -- Recording at RCA Studio B and Studio A -- Bob Luman story -- Sugar Bush excerpt (Steve Wariner) -- Fame and nice guy label -- performances include; God Rest Ye Merry, Gentlemen -- Santa Claus Is Coming To Town -- The Christmas Song -- Jingle Bells -- I'm Dreaming Of A White Christmas -- On Christmas Morning.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wariner, Steve; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
